summary:
The Security Council,
Reaffirming previous resolutions on Afghanistan, particularly 1386 (2001), 1413 (2002), 1444 (2002), 1510 (2003), and 1563 (2004), 
Reaffirming commitment to Afghanistan's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and national unity, 
Also reaffirming resolutions 1368 (2001) and 1373 (2001) on terrorism, 
Recognizing Afghan responsibility for security and law and order, 
Welcoming cooperation between the Government of Afghanistan and the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF), 
Recalling the Bonn Agreement and Berlin Declaration, 
Stressing the importance of extending central government authority, respecting democratic values, completing disarmament and reintegration, 
Recognizing challenges in Afghanistan, particularly in security, 
Welcoming NATO's commitment to establish Provincial Reconstruction Teams (PRTs), 
Appreciating ISAF's and Operation Enduring Freedom Coalition's role in securing national elections, 
Expressing appreciation to Italy for leading ISAF and to contributing nations, 
Determining the situation in Afghanistan still threatens international peace and security, 
Decides to:
1. Extend ISAF's authorization for 12 months beyond 13 October 2005; 
2. Authorize ISAF participants to take necessary measures to fulfil its mandate; 
3. Call on Member States to contribute personnel, equipment, and resources to ISAF; 
4. Request ISAF to work in close consultation with the Government of Afghanistan and the Special Representative of the Secretary-General; 
5. Request quarterly reports from ISAF leadership on its mandate implementation; 
6. Remain actively seized of the matter.
